intro: Epidendrum flavum var. fuscosepalum, commonly known as the Brown-sepal Epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with brownish sepals, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, tropical environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. This variety is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
